title: Copywriter
content:
MediaMonks is seeking a talented and experienced Bilingual Copywriter to join our team and work on creating compelling content for social media channels that target a Hispanic audience with a passion for music. As a Copywriter, you will be responsible for generating clear ideas, producing social-first concepts and executions, and sometimes for traditional media, including 360 big campaigns ideas, innovation, and digital & social media best practices.
Responsibilities:

Develop creative concepts that deliver against the approved creative brief and brand & product guidelines.
Understand marketing initiatives, strategic positioning, and target audience.
Work with other creative Monks to brainstorm ideas, and campaigns and win new projects.
Develop and manage all creative executions, including design and production across all platforms.
Incorporate consumer insights into the creative process and ensure messaging consistency across all vehicles.
Take work from concept to final execution ensuring deliverables are on time and on budget.
Present completed ideas to clients/team members & participate in status calls as needed.
QA all creative assets to ensure quality & error-free.
Stay on top of all trends and maintain best practices, particularly digital & social media.
Report the progress of projects at major stages of their conception, creation, and execution.
Ensure designs and content reflect consistency, and positivity, towards the brand image and company ideals.
Work with internal and external strategic partners to create products using the most current industry best practices.
Anticipate problems and implement solutions to ensure project completion on tight deadlines.
Use data-driven insights to help personalize content across the entire customer journey.
Contribute to improving our workflows, best practices, and client relationships across brands.

Requirements:

More than 3+ years of experience as a bilingual copywriter, preferably in the entertainment industry.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and Spanish 
Knowledge of how to develop brand identities through multi-channel marketing.
Evidence of participation in ongoing professional development opportunities in the areas of social media.
Talent in presenting information concisely and accurately, with keen attention to detail.
Curiosity of culture and local strategic insights infused into creative work.
You can produce quality content out of thin air and based on briefs or input written by others.
You have a proven ability to tackle the same topic from a variety of angles by combining creativity with critical thinking.
Your analytical approach means you ask the right questions and make sense of complex content and marketing strategies.
You’re comfortable and capable of presenting work to clients—always able to rationalize your choices and considerations to win people over with your words.

What We Offer:
Media.Monks has provided a compensation range that represents its good faith estimate of what Media.Monks may pay for the position at the time of posting. Media.Monks may ultimately pay more or less than the posted compensation range. The salary offered to the selected candidate will be determined based on job-related factors, but not based on a candidate’s sex or any other protected status.
Los Angeles salary range: 
$85,000 — $95,000 USD
Benefits:

Excellent, full coverage medical, dental, and vision insurance with employer-paid HRA
Unlimited PTO and 15 company-wide holidays
401k with company contribution
Paid parental leave
Work-life balance with an emphasis on personal well-being with subscriptions to Headspace, employee assistance program, and access to fitness apps
Lifestyle Spending Account (LSA) for you to use on financial and emotional well-being programs
Career growth in a disruptor space & entrepreneurial opportunities within the Media.Monks network 
A globally diverse & inclusive culture with employee resource groups such as S4 Melanin, Pride.Monks, Cultura.Monks, and more!
Authentic commitment to DEI efforts and sustainable growth. (Why Sir Martin Sorrell signed The Climate Pledge here!)

 
#LI-AO1
#LI-HybridAbout Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
